Reviews.Title: Reasons This Is A Good Phone
Reviews.Author: W. freeman
Reviews.Content: For starters i really hate big flat bulky regular cell phones. I don't like to have to lock and unlock the phone to use it every time i need to make a call of want to text etc. Flips phones are dying quickly, why? Well because everyone wants to look cool while using their touch screen phone to text or just scroll down through things like they are doing something important. I think it's much cooler (not that i care) to receive a call flip open the phone, talk, then flip the phone shut and be done with it, without having to touch ANY buttons what so ever. The phone is decently made, not made of steel, but hey, what is. It's also very compact and fits right into my pocket with ease. All without having to worry about dialing numbers or hitting send while being tucked away. My dad has left his phone on several times because he forgot to lock it after a call, or forgot to hit the end button after the call. He actually wasted over 200 minutes one time.Other good features are that the speaker phone is very loud, it plays MP3s which are also very loud, and the ring tones are actually TOO loud, but it's easy to adjust by the simple volume button on the side. It plays Mp4s, wmv, mpeg and about any other format of video that you can think of, yes the screen is small but if your bored you can watch a whole movie with ease, and the picture actually looks good. A few gripes is that there are no other settings for receiving and IM other than the default. The navigation is a little tricky, yet smooth once you figure out where everything is. Yes the phone seems, and maybe even looks dated, but i could care less, i have no interest in launching the space shuttle, or even opening my locked doors at home with a PHONE!! I use it for phone calls that's it.I had the LG 900 which i thought was a good deal, and ending up being a nightmare because NO one could hear me, no matter how good the signal or how loud i spoke. The virgin mobile version of this phone is bad, not because of the phone, but because the service is the most limited you can find. Especially here in WV with all the mountains etc. I haven't had one problem getting a full signal everywhere i go. And not even close to a dropped call. I use to love the 2009 Samsung phone i had with the drop down keyboard, but once again, lock, unlock, lock, unlock, what a pain! Also it couldn't even play regular videos and the mp3's sounded like crap. Also this phone has FM radio for if your out in the forest or somewhere camping perhaps?So all in all this is a really good phone and i definitely prefer this type of flip phone over any type of Android, or Iphone. I work on computers and love electronics but this phone thing has really gone to far. If you can't wait until you get home to check email, facebook, or browse the web, then you have some issues.(Which this phone can do, i just don't use it for that). Use a laptop or netbook. So don't let the lack of or bad reviews steer you clear of this phone, most are not with NET10, with whom i've had for over 5 years and no problems at all. Most of those reviews are straight talk, AT&T; or Virgin Mobile. So enjoy flipping your phone on and off, i do. Later.I put my 4 gig card in the back of the phone, works great.

Reviews.Title: lots of value
Reviews.Author: Running for Life "Tiger"
Reviews.Content: This phone has a lot of features including FM radio, MP3 player and a pretty good camera. Overall it works very well and it is well suited for someone who doesn't want An 'I' or Android Phone. Only shortcoming I found was a lack of directions for using the speed dial, accessing voicemail, etc. Emails requesting help were promptly returned.

Reviews.Title: feature rich for it's level
Reviews.Author: Howard L Lambert
Reviews.Content: The W409G (aka W418G, WX345) could be a cool phone for someone who values a good camera, music player, removable memory OVER indoor reception, internet, games, apps (kinda hard to get all in this price range).  Fact is, it actually has a lot more features than equally priced phones.I really wanted to keep it, but I don't get very good reception inside my house (1-2 bars, 3 on a good day) and I've read Verizon phones get better coverage at our isolated central CA coast. I also hate not being able to swap out the retarded games and that I can't find any plastic/rubber covers to protect the fragile glass on the phone's front (only found bulky leather cases and useless vinyl skins).  I had to return it and am going to try some other phones...maybe I'll come back.PROS: *  Loud rings *  Loud speaker-phone *  Caller ID on outer display (number only) *  2 megapixel camera + video recorder *  MP3 player + FM radio *  Accepts up to 32 Gigabyte of removable memory *  Standard 3.5 mm earphone jack *  Voice recorderCONS: *  Tiny 1.5 inch screen w/poor res *  Very limited/slow 2G mobile web *  w/ slow 2G, 10¢ per minute web use is high (other cell providers only charge 99¢ all day - and only on the days you use it) *  Non-functional calculator *  Useless "games & apps" *  No dust cover on USB port *  No OEM or third party protective covers

Reviews.Title: A Decent Phone
Reviews.Author: BillPeek
Reviews.Content: Nice appearance.  Phone works quite well.  However, when trying to watch a video, a "Video failed to open" error message always pops up, even with videos  of the correct format.  Its Motorola BQ50 battery is long-lasting (my previous phone used it) and replacements for it are inexpensive.  When I registered the phone online, its activation was virtually instantaneous.The MP3 player sounds fine with a pair of Sony W08 headphones purchased for around $8 from --who else? -- Amazon.  However, the phone has only a few MB of  available memory, so a microSD card is a must.  But the card must be inserted inside the phone in a slot similar to a SIM card slot and apparently isn't intended to be removed often once it is installed.  It might, therefore, be a good idea to add music to the phone using a USB cable, which isn't included with the phone.

Reviews.Title: fantastic phone! but very poor support from NET10
Reviews.Author: P. Mistretta "Phillip2167"
Reviews.Content: i purchased this phone from net10's website. 750 minutes for $27.65 is a heck of a lot better than just 300 minutes from virgin mobile for the same price. i quickly found out this phone has an annoying problem. like other cellphone companies you have a choice of numbers, not net10! your assigned a number at random. here is its biggest problem! all phones receive a signal from the cell towers telling the day date and year and current time displayed on the phone. for some reason net10 doesn't have this feature available in my city? where do live, i live in brooklyn new york! my phone currently reads January 7th 2004 4:05am. and there is no way of manually setting this feature!i called net10 customer support, and of course there support is based in India! i spent 30 minutes on the phone with a man that had such a heavy accent i had to have him repeat himself two and three times! he first told me to take the battery and the phones SIM card out, when that didn't work, he said to reset the phone to factory defaults, that didn't work, then i was put on hold for over 10 minutes! then another man came on the line and said that "because the auto update feature is not available in my city, or on their towers yet there is no fix for this problem until the towers are updated, only then will my phone show the current day date time and year" i asked how long will that be? he said they don't know? he said that my name was going to be on a list of those who complained about this problem. like that would make it happen faster! this isnt a small issue. if you need to rely on your phones time, or tell what time you missed the call!this phone company should have a warning!...net10 cell towers in your area may or may not be updated to send your phone the correct time,day date and year. five stars for the Motorola name brand! this phone is feather lite and has a battery life of almost 5 days in standby mode! one star for net10's customer support! it really stinks having a phone that displays the wrong time day date and year!i will wait 90 days! if the problem isn't corrected by then. i'm cancelling my service!

Reviews.Title: Phone is great, net10 is not for me
Reviews.Author: M. Collins
Reviews.Content: I returned this phone because I decided that Net10 was not what I wanted. Literally less than a minute of activating my phone with a new number, I received a spam call. Shortly after that I started receiving spam texts! I decided to not go with Net10 so I returned the phone. But it seemed like a pretty good phone for $30.I didn't use the phone for long, but it appeared to be good quality. The buttons are large and easy to access. It's very basic but would fit the needs of someone who just needs texts and voice calls. The camera is very basic as well.Overall, I decided not to go with net10 for a few reasons beyond the spam calls/texts with the number.1) Picture messages cost 2.5 minutes each, and I normally send a fair amount of picture messages of my daughter to keep in touch with grandparents so they can be a part of our daily lives even though they are in another state. My minutes would probably not last long.. I was going to try the 300 minutes for $30 dollars. Those 300 would go fast given how much I use the phone, and it would not end up being affordable for me.2) There's no way to see who sends a text to you, without opening the text message. It costs to open the message, so you could be paying for a spam text.I decided it wasn't for me and had myself added to a pre-existing family plan with my family so we could keep in touch better.Net10 isn't horrible I am sure, but it's not for me. It would be better for those who rarely use their phone, or just need a cheaper non-contract phone to use. Or someone who doesn't need picture messaging on a regular basis. I decided that I would be using my phone more heavily than I had originally anticipated, so a family plan was the best idea.If you need a basic phone and are okay with the plans that net10 offers, this motorola will probably work perfectly for you.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: C. R. Martin "Renaisance Man"
Reviews.Content: This phone is precisely that: a phone. While it offers the ability to browse the web, take photo's and videos, listen to music (even FM radio!), text and photo message, and all the various miscellaneous tasks we've come to associate with the devices we now associate with the term "phone", this one is, at it's core, truly, a phone!We were looking for "a phone" to enable us to remain in contact on those rare occasions when we weren't at home and needed to be reached by family, or for a true emergency. This fit the bill nicely. It's compact and exceptionally lightweight. "Butt-dialing" isn't possible as it's a flip phone. The screen, while small, is clear and easily read. If you need to take photo's (an accident perhaps or Aunt Bessie's 90th Birthday?) the camera is capable of multiple resolutions and is easily handled.Combined with Net10's very flexible service packages, this phone is just the ticket for those who need just that: a phone and good, reliable service at a minimum of cost, fuss and bother.

Reviews.Title: Simple, yet highly adequate
Reviews.Author: J. Dryer
Reviews.Content: This is a very simple flip phone.  No real frills like the i-phones available today.  But, all I use it for is what a phone is intended for....to make and receive calls.  Sound is crisp and clear.  Various ringtones and graphics are available thru Net 10 if you so desire.  Texting, which I occassionally use, is old school, but not a bother as I seldom use it anyways.  For a simple to use, basic clear sounding phone, I certainly would recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for brother.
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Brother is 57, not too techy. He loves this phone. Has all the imprtant features for him; clear, loud enough, not too complicated, shows who is calling, good Motorola quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent simple phone
Reviews.Author: Wise Shopper
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple phone that was bluetooth compatible but had as few bells and whistles as possible. This phone fit the bill, though it has a camera and capability for texting. I'm happy with phone and also with Net10.

Reviews.Title: Better than the 408g
Reviews.Author: vangeek
Reviews.Content: Basic, no frills phone. Its much better than its bastard cousin the 408G. Still its not a smart phone, and its Motorolla/Net10, so don't go expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: Missing mode...
Reviews.Author: minnies
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this phone from Motorola W408G.  This phone is neat, but it does not have a complete silent, or shut off vibrate mode.  It takes getting used to using this new phone.  I like that it automatically saves messages into draft when I accidentally don't save. I like that the back cover is on tight.  The W408G's back cover came off, and I didn't relize it was gone until I was making a call. Other than that, I like this phone...

Reviews.Title: Might have been a nice phone.......
Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: I never really goit to find out. I bought this to replace an older Net10 phone. A month after activation it stopped sending and receiving sound. I contacted Net10 "service/support" where I embarked on a two month endeavor to get what should have been a simple problem resolved. Net10 may sell decent phones but their "customer service" is the worst I've encountered in my entire life! I'm out the cost of my phone, the  minutes I never got to use and hours and hours of time wasted just so that I could have a working phone to buy more minutes for!

Reviews.Title: good enough
Reviews.Author: ccbenn
Reviews.Content: Its a simple flip phone that's why I like it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz!  zzzzzzzzzxxxxxxx! you got it all I want to say!! swell

Reviews.Title: excellent phone
Reviews.Author: jrh enterprizes 2011
Reviews.Content: I use this phone as a phone not for texting. its very reasonably priced so it fits my budget perfectly

Reviews.Title: No Joy
Reviews.Author: T. Delaune
Reviews.Content: I really liked this phone.  It's just the size I wanted, just a simple phone.  Verizon would not let me use it because it needed to be specific for Verizon.  So, if you are just going to get a prepaid card I think it would work great, but double check with your provider before purchasing a phone on line.  But Amazon was great and I was able to return it for a complete refund with no problems at all.  After I returned this I went back to Amazon to find a Verizon compatible phone and bought it.  Now, for the kicker, Verizon still wouldn't let me use that phone, I had to return the second one as well.  Amazon has much better customer service than Verizon does.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for entry-level
Reviews.Author: CrunchyCookie
Reviews.Content: This is your standard no-frills $30ish flip-phone -- the type everyone had about ten years ago.  If all you care about is making a call once in a while, it should suit you just fine since it nails the core strengths: the keys are nice, big, solid, and rubberized, and voice quality is quite clear.  With Bluetooth, a 2 megapixel camera, and room for a 32MB SD memory card, the specs ain't bad at all, and it has expected functions like an MP3 player, FM radio, and voice & video recorders.  There's also a "browser" that's probably best left unused, plus one nice feature all phones should have: the ability to turn itself off/on at preset times.Motorola got some of the details wrong though.  The menu layouts can be counterintuitive, with some functions/adjustments buried in areas you wouldn't expect, which can call for weird sequences of button pressing (even the calculator is screwy, with the decimal key being way up at the top of the pad).  I also can't believe this phone doesn't let you customize the 4-way shortcut keys on the directional pad -- this has been standard on every phone for years, and you'd think it'd be super easy to add.  Also, the charging port is proprietary instead of MicroUSB, so you'll have to buy a cable if you ever want to transfer data.So it's still a good enough phone, but the funny thing is that Motorola already topped it with a model they released back in 2009 called the EM326G -- a slider phone that can do almost everything this one can do while sharing few of the flaws (i.e. it has MicroUSB and programmable shortcuts, plus it looks cooler).  It isn't sold in stores anymore but it's still readily available both here and on eBay, so I say try that one before this.

Reviews.Title: Motorola W409G
Reviews.Author: Starwood
Reviews.Content: The phone works OK, lot of dropped call's, think it is not so powerful of a receiver. Other cell on the same service works ok at my home. Also it is hard to open the phone with one hand. Sound is ok and it plays music and videos OK. The Blue Tooth work ok also

Reviews.Title: Nothing but trouble
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: After my Motorola W375 phone went dead I decided to stick with the Motorola brand and pick up a similiar model. That being the W409g. However, it did not take long for me to dislike the phone. First, the volume controls were located in a place so that every time I pulled the phone out of its carrying case it would change the volume level. Next, the design of the phone made it difficult to grab hold of it and open it quickly. I had to fumble around with it so that one hand was holding one side and my other hand the other side so I could pull it apart. In addition, whether being slightly smaller or smoother in texture than my 375 model, the phone slipped out of my case and I lost it, only to get it back several days later after having to deal with the headache of Net 10 customer service. And finally, once I did get it back I installed a 16 GB memory card, and when I hooked up my computer to the phone the computer did not recognize the card. This in addition to the memory card falling apart inside the phone. Then I had to destroy the memory card connector of the phone in order to get the memory card out, Just problems and bad luck with this phone. Replaced it with the LG 800. The new memory card installed quickly and worked from the start. Happy that I replaced the Motorola with the LG which appears to be a far superior product.

Reviews.Title: A good simple phone
Reviews.Author: L. Da Vinci "Renaissance Man"
Reviews.Content: This phone is used as an emergency phone, if I leave home or lose  my smart phone, and when someone needs to borrow a phone, this is the one I lend. The voice quality is good, the ringing is loud and adequate. It is tedious to enter numbers in the memory, but, as an emergency phone, I only needed about ten numbers to enter in its memory. Good price, good quality.

Reviews.Title: Motorola flip phone
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Stichick
Reviews.Content: Great little Net-10 Phone.  Small, convenient, lots of features, good voice quality, inexpensive and easy to use.  Keep it in the car with my hands-free Bluetooth.  It works great.  Strongly recommend the W409G and Net 10.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the money
Reviews.Author: David Jones
Reviews.Content: A very good phone with good reception. Easy to use with intuitive menus. Loads of features such as camera, calculator, calendar, calculator, mp3, fm radio, Bluetooth and more. For $29.99 it's a good deal. On sale at $9.99, it's a fantastic deal. Nothing to dislike!David.

Reviews.Title: Ran out of Days to test
Reviews.Author: james rosar
Reviews.Content: Seemed ok reception wize ran out of days to test fully Motorola radio has best radio for good clear voice in fringe areas

Reviews.Title: exactly what i was looking for
Reviews.Author: colby
Reviews.Content: the title says it all, i was very pleased. Didn't want a big fancy phone with a million buttons. it makes calls, sends a receives texts, has a camera….ok the camera is pretty much useless takes crap photos, but thats why i already have a digital camera… but i digress. good basic phone, good price, it works for what need from it.

Reviews.Title: My opinion
Reviews.Author: dAVE
Reviews.Content: Real basic phone.  Small and light.  It is as durable as any phone and if your main desire is to talk, it will get the job done.  I don't talk much and this phone goes 5-7 days between charges. Not a lot of features, but I like it.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Its8up
Reviews.Content: I have had some problems with cheap NET10 phones but this phone is the worst!!!!!  From time to time it incurs a "network fail" and drops the call.  Once a call is dropped due to network failure it may take 5 minutes or so for the signal to return.  Upon regaining signal the average consumer will redial in an attempt to finish their call.  This turd of a phone will almost certainly incur another network fail within 3 minutes (often in less than 1 minute) which leaves the consumer with no signal for an additional ridiculous period of time.You would certainly be better off with ANY other NET10 phone. ....but be warned - if you choose the Motorola W408g you should also purchase a roll of duct tape to secure the battery cover else it will fall apart - even when in shirt pocket.

Reviews.Title: Gift fo my Wife
Reviews.Author: Retired Rider
Reviews.Content: Purchased for the bluetooth to use with in-car speakerphone, Motorola TX500. Have had Net10 for many years. Very happy with the and this set-up.

Reviews.Title: Phone is junk...
Reviews.Author: susan
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I wanted a flip phone. because my phone with keyboard would dial anybody including 911 once. This phone had the worst reception. I had the same net 10 service and used the phone in different areas and most every time the phone would not come in. I usually buy LG. Well I went to  the local kmart and bought another open face keyboard phone. Should have sent it back but it wasn't worth the bother......

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: antholious prefabrage
Reviews.Content: i only wish this phone had a bigger screen and had 3g web browsing. it has great big buttons that arranged perfectly. too bad the screen is so small. i waiting for net10 to come out with a similar phone that is bigger screen!!

ProductInfo.Features:
Compact Flip Phone
Mobile Web
Bluetooth® Wireless Technology
2 MP Camera/Video Recorder
MP3 Player (cable and microSD? Card up to 32GB not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Motorola W409G Prepaid Phone (Net10)
